required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endocation: Trial of an Endometriosis Education Program
clinical_study.official_title: Endocation: A Pilot Randomized Cluster Controlled Trial of an Endometriosis Education Program for Middle and Secondary School Students

brief_summary.textblock: Endometriosis is a common condition that affects 10% of females, causing chronic pain and other health concerns. Currently, it takes 8-12 years to be diagnosed with endometriosis, in part because there is low awareness of this condition. This research is designed to test whether providing endometriosis education in schools can help increase early awareness of the condition.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in menstrual health and endometriosis knowledge
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using a built for purpose questionnaire, possible scores range from 0 to 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in prioritization of menstrual health
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using a built for purpose item, possible scores range from 0 to 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in confidence in endometriosis knowledge
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using a built for purpose item, possible scores range from 0 to 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in comfort with menstrual health
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using a built for purpose item, possible scores range from 0 to 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of menstrual health and endometriosis education (quantitative)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following education in intervention and waitlist control group
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using a built for purpose questionnaire, possible scores range from 0 to 35

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of menstrual health and endometriosis education (qualitative)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following education in intervention and waitlist control group
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using open-ended responses a built for purpose questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Refusal of participants invited to participate
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who refuse to participate divided by the number of participants invited to participate
Number of participants completing the study divided by the number of participants enrolled

intervention.description: One-time educational session about menstrual health and endometriosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 8-12 grade level class
Exclusion Criteria:
- Instruction offered in a language other than English
